title: Acera
text:
Acera is a "<a href="frazione">frazione</a>" of the "<a href="comune">comune</a>" of <a href="Campello%20sul%20Clitunno">Campello sul Clitunno</a> in the <a href="Province%20of%20Perugia">Province of Perugia</a>, <a href="Umbria">Umbria</a>, central <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. It stands at an elevation of 972 metres above sea level. At the time of the <a href="National%20Institute%20of%20Statistics%20%28Italy%29">Istat</a> census of 2001 it had 19 inhabitants.
History.
Near the town, which gets its name from the surrounding maple woods, at Monte Maggiore (1.430), there were found 
prehistoric and Roman remains. The Castello di Acera (The maple castle) was built in 1296 by a <a href="Podest%C3%A0">Podestà</a> sent from 
<a href="Spoleto">Spoleto</a> to unite the dispersed population of the villages Acera and <a href="Spina">Spina</a>.
After the <a href="Italian%20unification">Italian unification</a> of 1860 it became part of <a href="Campello%20sul%20Clitunno">Campello sul Clitunno</a>.
